DOCNAME: CASE OF PRINCE HANS-ADAM II OF LIECHTENSTEIN v. GERMANY
CONCLUSION: No violation of Art. 6-1;No violation of P1-1;No violation of Art. 14
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is the monarch of GPE , born in DATE and living in GPE ( GPE ) .

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s late father , the former monarch of GPE , had been the owner of the painting Szene an einem römischen GPE ( alias Der große GPE ) of PERSON , which had formed part of his family ’s art collection since DATE . Until DATE the Second World War the painting had been in one of the family ’s castles on the territory of the now GPE .

CARDINAL . In DATE the former GPE confiscated the property of the applicant ’s father which was situated in its territory , including the painting in question , under Decree no . CARDINAL on the “ confiscation and accelerated allocation of agricultural property of NORP and NORP persons and of those having committed treason and acted as enemies of the NORP and NORP people ” ( dekretu prezidenta republiky č . CARDINAL/CARDINAL PERSON . o konfiskaci a urychleném rozdělení majetku PERSON , ORG , zrádců a nepřátel ) , issued by the President of the former GPE on DATE ( “ the Beneš Decrees ” – “ GPE dekrety ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( správní soud ) dismissed the appeal lodged by the applicant ’s father .

In its reasoning on the merits of the case , ORG stated that the defendant office had come to the conclusion that the appellant was a person of NORP nationality within the meaning of the provision in LAW ( a ) of the decree , on the basis of a finding that this was and had been generally known . It noted that the defence of the complaint directed against this finding was restricted to the representation that this finding was not supported in the files and that , due to this shortcoming , it had not been necessary to deal with the finding in greater detail . ORG considered that this approach was mistaken as , under the relevant provision of the administrative regulations , no evidence was required for facts which were generally known and , therefore , it was not necessary for evidence to be contained in the administrative files ; however , counter - evidence against an official finding that a certain fact was generally known would have been admitted .

ORG concluded that , as the appellant had failed to raise the objection that the issue was not a fact of general knowledge and to contend that he was in a position to bring counter - evidence , the finding of the defendant office had remained uncontested .
CARDINAL . In DATE the municipality of GPE obtained the painting as a temporary loan from ORG in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Landgericht ) granted the applicant ’s request for an interim injunction ordering the municipality of GPE to hand over the painting to a bailiff at the end of the exhibition . The painting was sequestrated on DATE .

CARDINAL . At DATE the applicant instituted proceedings before ORG against the municipality of GPE , requesting that the defendant consent to the delivery of the painting to him by the bailiff . He argued that , as his late father ’s heir , he was the owner of the painting . He submitted that the painting had not been subject to expropriation measures in the former GPE and that in any event such measures were invalid or irrelevant on account of violation of the ordre public of GPE .

CARDINAL . ORG intervened in these proceedings in support of the defendant . It submitted that the applicant ’s father had lost his ownership of the painting as a result of the confiscation in DATE and that the lawfulness of this confiscation had been confirmed by ORG in its decision of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , following a hearing , declared the applicant ’s action inadmissible . In the court ’s view , LAW , LAW , of ORG ( PERSON aus ORG entstandener DATE “ the FAC ” ) of DATE between GPE , GPE and GPE , GPE and GPE excluded NORP jurisdiction over the applicant ’s case .

In its reasoning , ORG noted that , under the terms of that Article ’s paragraph CARDINAL taken in conjunction with paragraph CARDINAL , claims or actions against persons having acquired or transferred title to property on the basis of measures carried out with regard to NORP external assets or other property , seized for the purpose of reparation or restitution , or as a result of the state of war , or on the basis of specific agreements , were not admissible . These particular provisions had been confirmed upon NORP unification .

According to ORG , Chapter CARDINAL , LAW , of ORG applied , mutatis mutandis , to the applicant ’s claims against the defendant , which had obtained the painting on loan and had not acquired property , because any review of the aforementioned measures should be excluded .

ORG found that the confiscation of the applicant ’s father ’s property under Decree no . CARDINAL on the “ confiscation and accelerated allocation of agricultural property of NORP and NORP persons and of those having committed treason and acted as enemies of the NORP and NORP people ” , issued by the President of the former GPE on DATE , constituted a measure within the meaning of LAW , LAW .

ORG rejected , in particular , the applicant ’s argument that this provision did not apply as it only concerned measures carried out with regard to NORP external assets or other property and his father had never been a NORP citizen . In this respect , the court , referring to case - law of ORG ( ORG ) , stated that the view of the confiscating ORG was decisive . The aim and purpose of this provision , namely to sanction , without any further examination , confiscation measures implemented abroad could only be achieved by excluding such measures from judicial review in GPE .

Moreover , ORG found that the confiscation measure in question pursued CARDINAL of the purposes mentioned in LAW , LAW . Having regard to NORP case - law regarding other “ ORG Decrees ” , especially Decree no . CARDINAL on the “ confiscation of enemy property and the national reform fund ” , it considered that Decree no . CARDINAL , while also pursuing economic aims , was intended to expropriate the property of NORP and NORP nationals , that is , “ enemy property ” .

ORG further noted that the applicant ’s father ’s painting had been expropriated under Decree no . CARDINAL . The competent NORP authorities had interpreted its provisions as applying to the applicant ’s father , regarding him as a “ person of NORP nationality ” . The applicant ’s father had unsuccessfully appealed against this decision which ORG had been confirmed by ORG in DATE . The NORP courts were not in a position to review the lawfulness of the confiscation at issue .
Finally , ORG considered that the painting at issue , as part of the inventory of the agricultural property , had been included in the confiscation measure .

ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request to suspend the proceedings in order to await the outcome of proceedings to be instituted under the NORP Equalisation of Burdens Act ( GPE ) concerning compensation for damage and losses due to , inter alia , expulsion and destruction during the Second World War and the post - war period in the then NORP - occupied zone of GPE and of GPE . ORG considered that the question underlying the litigation before it would not be clarified in such proceedings . Irrespective of the question of whether the plaintiff was of NORP origin , he had no equalisation claims under the said legislation , which only applied to persons who resided in GPE or GPE on DATE . In any event , there was no right to compensation for the loss of works of art ( ORG ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Oberlandesgericht ) dismissed the applicant ’s appeal . ORG confirmed that the applicant ’s action was inadmissible as NORP jurisdiction in respect of his claim was excluded under LAW , LAW , in conjunction with paragraph CARDINAL , of LAW .

ORG considered that the notion of NORP jurisdiction included the competence , derived from ORG sovereignty and generally vested by the ORG in the courts , to administer justice . NORP jurisdiction was delimited by international agreements , customary international law and the generally recognised rules of international law . LAW , LAW , taken in conjunction with paragraph CARDINAL , of the Settlements Convention excluded NORP jurisdiction in respect of claims and actions against persons , who , as a consequence of reparation measures , had directly or indirectly acquired title to NORP property confiscated abroad .

ORG confirmed that the provisions in question continued to be in force under LAW of DATE on ORG with respect to GPE . DATE , which provided for the termination of the operation of quadripartite rights and responsibilities with respect to GPE and GPE as a whole , was amended by LAW and DATE according to which ORG was suspended and later terminated with the exception of the provisions specified in paragraph CARDINAL of that Agreement , inter alia , LAW , LAW § CARDINAL and DATE . That Agreement was valid under public international law and under NORP constitutional law .

ORG further considered that LAW , LAW , of ORG applied in the applicant ’s case . In the court ’s view , this provision was the procedural consequence of the notion that the legal relations resulting from the liquidation of NORP property abroad by foreign powers for the purpose of reparation were “ final and unchallengeable ” ( PERSON ) for GPE and the private persons concerned .

According to ORG , the applicant ’s constitutional rights , in particular his right to property , his right of access to a court and his right to a decision by the legally competent court ( gesetzlicher Richter ) , had not been infringed . Basic rights protected individuals against acts of domestic public authorities and not against the exercise of public authority by a foreign ORG abroad . The domestic legislator was therefore not prevented from limiting domestic legal protection against violations of basic rights by a foreign ORG if this was necessary to attain more important goals .

When applying LAW , LAW , of ORG , the domestic law of the expropriating ORG concerning the concrete confiscation measure had to be taken into account , as this provision was aimed at excluding litigation in GPE regarding confiscation measures based on legislation concerning enemy property .

As regards the applicant ’s objections against the lawfulness , in particular under public international law , of the confiscation and expropriation of his father ’s property , ORG found that by virtue of LAW , LAW of ORG , NORP courts had no jurisdiction . Likewise , this provision did not allow recourse to be had to general rules of public international law or to NORP ordre public when examining the admissibility of the action . The applicant ’s argument that the provisions of ORG and their application to him as a national and head of a neutral ORG violated the law of peace was accordingly rejected .

According to ORG , the painting at issue constituted external assets within the meaning of LAW , LAW , of ORG , referred to in paragraph CARDINAL of Article CARDINAL . ORG noted that the applicant ’s father had indisputably never had NORP nationality . However , following the case - law of ORG , it considered that the notion of “ NORP external assets ” had to be interpreted in the light of the law of the expropriating ORG . The confiscation in dispute had been found to be in compliance with the legislation of the expropriating ORG : the competent NORP administrative authorities as well as ORG had found that Presidential Decree no . CARDINAL of DATE applied to the applicant ’s father ’s confiscated property . LAW ( a ) of this decree provided for the confiscation of agricultural properties of “ all persons of NORP or NORP nationality ” irrespective of their citizenship . The notions of “ NORP nationality ” , or of “ NORP origin ” ( “ deutsche GPE ” ) , likewise used at that time , comprised as relevant elements a person ’s citizenship and nationality , the latter depending on the mother tongue . At the relevant time , the NORP authorities indisputably regarded the applicant ’s father as of NORP origin in that broader sense .

ORG also found that the painting at issue , as part of the confiscated agricultural property , had been subject to the expropriation measure . There were no doubts as to the effectiveness of the expropriation , as it was sufficient under the relevant case - law that such expropriations had been implemented and that the previous owners had been deprived of their factual power of disposition . Furthermore , the painting had been confiscated for the purpose of reparation within the meaning of LAW , LAW CARDINAL , of ORG . The limitation of the confiscation measures to persons belonging to enemy GPE in itself justified such a conclusion . The assets of the persons concerned were confiscated as enemy assets .

Finally , ORG considered that both the defendant and the intervener belonged to the group of persons protected by LAW , LAW , of ORG . NORP jurisdiction was excluded whenever the plaintiff intended to challenge measures within the meaning of LAW , LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to entertain the applicant ’s appeal on points of law , as the case was of no fundamental importance and , in any event , had no prospect of success .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Third Section of the Second Division ( CARDINAL . Kammer des zweiten GPE ) of ORG ( Bundesverfassungsgericht ) refused to entertain the applicant ’s constitutional complaint ( ORG ) , as it offered no prospect of success .

ORG considered in particular that , for the purposes of the civil court decisions , questions as to the existence or non - existence of certain rules of customary international law on the confiscation of neutral assets or on the determination of citizenship were irrelevant as they concerned the issue of the lawfulness of the expropriation by the former GPE . The NORP civil courts had not decided this issue and , under public international law , they had not been obliged to do so . Moreover , to the extent that the civil courts had regarded the expropriation as a measure within the meaning of LAW , LAW , of LAW , they had expressly refrained from qualifying the applicant ’s father ’s nationality . Their interpretation of the terms “ measures with regard to NORP external assets ” as comprising any measures which , in the intention of the expropriating ORG , were directed against NORP assets , could not be objected to under constitutional law . The bar on litigation did not constitute an agreement to the detriment of GPE , as only GPE and its courts were under this treaty obligation .

ORG further recalled that the exclusion of jurisdiction did not amount to a violation of the right of property as these clauses and LAW as a whole served to settle matters dating back to a time before the entry into force of LAW ) on DATE .

Finally , there was no indication of arbitrariness or of a violation of other constitutional rights . ORG confirmed that LAW , LAW and DATE , of ORG had not been set aside by LAW on LOC with respect to GPE : while GPE obtained full sovereignty , its obligations under treaties with the Three Powers were not affected . This had also been the legal opinion of GPE and ORG , which otherwise would not have settled the suspension and termination of parts of LAW in a separate agreement .
The decision was served on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG discharged its interim injunction of CARDINAL DATE . The bailiff thereupon handed the painting over to the GPE municipality , which had it returned to GPE .

CARDINAL . Beneš Decree no . CARDINAL on the “ confiscation and accelerated allocation of agricultural property of NORP and NORP persons and of those having committed treason and acted as enemies of the NORP and NORP people ” provided for the expropriation , with immediate effect and without compensation , of agricultural property , for the purposes of land reform . It concerned agricultural property , including , inter alia , buildings and movable goods on such property , in the ownership of all persons of NORP and NORP nationality irrespective of their citizenship status .

According to LAW said decree , those persons were to be considered as NORP or NORP nationals who , in any census since DATE , had declared to be of NORP or NORP nationality , or who had become members of national groups , formations or political parties which had been made up of persons of NORP or NORP nationality .

CARDINAL . After the NORP capitulation of DATE , ORG had assumed supreme authority in GPE , as stated in LAW of DATE ( Declaration regarding the defeat of GPE and the assumption of supreme authority with respect to GPE by ORG , ORG , GPE and ORG of GPE , LAW , vol . DATE , pp . CARDINAL et seq . ) . The supreme military commanders of the CARDINAL ORG administered their respective zones and dealt jointly , through ORG , with all matters relating to the country as a whole , namely military matters , transport , finance , economic affairs , reparations , justice , prisoners of war , communications , law and order , as well as political affairs .

CARDINAL . The Convention on the Settlement of Matters Arising out of the War and the Occupation ( “ LAW see paragraph CARDINAL above ) is CARDINAL of the “ GPE Conventions ” ( ORG ) signed by GPE , GPE , GPE and GPE at GPE on DATE , and designed to end the Occupation Regime .
The other LAW were :
– the Convention on Relations between the CARDINAL Powers and GPE ( “ the LAW ” ) ;
– the Convention on the Rights and Obligations of Foreign Forces and their Members in GPE ;
– the Finance Convention .
CARDINAL . LAW as such did not enter into force , but were amended in accordance with ORG to LAW , CARDINAL of the “ GPE Agreements ” , which were signed in GPE on DATE .

CARDINAL . DATE I which amends the above - mentioned LAW states that ORG will terminate the Occupation Regime in Western Germany , revoke LAW , and abolish the offices of ORG . GPE is accorded “ the full authority of a sovereign ORG over its internal and external affairs ” . According to LAW , the CARDINAL Powers retain their rights “ relating to GPE and to GPE as a whole , including the reunification of GPE and a peace settlement ” .
CARDINAL . The above - mentioned GPE Agreements comprise :
( CARDINAL ) documents signed by GPE and GPE , relating to disputes between GPE ( the resolution of cultural , economic and other difficulties ) and to the PERSON ;
( CARDINAL ) documents signed at the so - called CARDINAL - Power Conference by GPE , GPE , GPE and GPE , relating to NORP sovereignty and including in particular :
– the above - mentioned LAW on the Termination of the Occupation Regime in GPE and ORG thereto ( amending LAW , LAW and the other LAW ) , as well as letters dealing with specific points in LAW ;
– the Convention on the Presence of Foreign Forces in GPE ( in this context , mention should be made of LAW on GPE ) ;
( CARDINAL ) documents signed by GPE , the GPE , GPE , GPE , GPE , GPE and GPE , including the
– Protocol Modifying and Completing LAW ;
– Protocol on ORG ;
– Protocol on the Control of Armaments :
– Protocol on the Agency of ORG for ORG ;
– Resolution on the Production and Standardisation of Armaments ;
( CARDINAL ) documents signed by the CARDINAL countries party to LOC :
– Protocol to LOC on the Accession of GPE ;
– Resolution by ORG to implement LAW of LAW of the London Conference ;
– Resolution on the results of the Four- and ORG ;
– ORG taking note of the obligations accepted by GPE on the signature of the London Agreements and of the declaration relating to such obligations .

CARDINAL . Under the general provisions of LAW – PERSON , DATE , pp . CARDINAL et seq . ) , as amended by PERSON to LAW see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , the federal and the Land authorities were given powers to repeal or amend legislation enacted by ORG .

However , in many other respects , the status quo was confirmed . In particular , rights and obligations created or established by or under legislative , administrative or judicial action of the Occupation Authorities remained valid for all purposes under NORP law . The same applied to rights and obligations arising under treaties or international agreements which had been concluded on behalf of the CARDINAL GPE of Occupation by ORG or by the governments of ORG . Furthermore , there was a bar on prosecution of persons by action of NORP courts or authorities on the ground of having sympathised with , aided or supplied information or services to ORG or their ORG . NORP courts and authorities had as a rule no jurisdiction in any criminal or non - criminal proceedings relating to an act or omission which had occurred before the date of entry into force of this convention , if immediately prior to such date NORP courts and authorities were without jurisdiction with respect to such act or omission whether ratione materiae or ratione personae . The finality ( NORP ) , validity and enforceability of judgments and decisions in criminal or non - criminal matters rendered in GPE by tribunals or judicial authorities of ORG or any of them were confirmed .
CARDINAL . Chapter CARDINAL of the Settlement Convention concerns reparation issues and the relevant parts of Article CARDINAL provide as follows :

“ CARDINAL . GPE shall in the future raise no objections against the measures which have been , or will be , carried out with regard to NORP external assets or other property , seized for the purpose of reparation or restitution , or as a result of the state of war , or on the basis of agreements concluded , or to be concluded , by ORG with other ORG countries , neutral countries or former allies of GPE .

CARDINAL . No claim or action shall be admissible against persons who shall have acquired or transferred title to property on the basis of the measures referred to in paragraph CARDINAL ... of this Article , or against international organisations , foreign governments or persons who have acted upon instructions of such organisations or governments . ”

CARDINAL . At the CARDINAL - nation Paris Conference on Reparations in DATE and DATE , the participating GPE , including GPE , agreed on more detailed policies based upon the GPE undertakings ( provisions agreed upon at GPE on DATE between the governments of GPE , GPE and GPE and ORG ) in order to obtain an equitable distribution among themselves of the total assets available as reparation from GPE , to establish an ORG , and to settle an equitable procedure for the restitution of monetary gold .

ORG from GPE , on the Establishment of an ORG , and on ORG of DATE , LAW , vol . CARDINAL , p. CARDINAL ) established , inter alia , the shares which each country was to receive from NORP reparations . ORG , established in accordance with Part II of the Agreement , charged the reparation account of each signatory government for the NORP assets within that government ’s jurisdiction and maintained detailed accounts of assets available for , and of assets distributed as , NORP reparation .

CARDINAL . The Act on Losses due to Reparations of CARDINAL DATE ( Gesetz zur PERSON Reparations- , Restitutions- , Zerstörungs- und Rückerstattungsschäden – Reparationsschädengesetz , ORG I , DATE , p. CARDINAL ) was CARDINAL of the statutes passed to deal with the consequences of the Second World War and the collapse of the ORG regime .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the Act provided a general definition of losses due to reparations , the relevant parts of which read as follows :

“ A loss due to reparations in the meaning of this LAW is any loss , which occurred in the context of the events and consequences of the Second World War , including also the occupation regime , and resulted from the fact that economic goods were taken away

CARDINAL . NORP in currently occupied NORP territories or in territories outside ORG on the basis of measures carried out by foreign States with regard to NORP assets , in particular on the basis of legislation on enemy property ,

CARDINAL . Sections CARDINAL to CARDINAL laid down the conditions of compensation for losses . The LAW was limited to losses suffered by natural persons ( section PERSON ) ) . In case of losses which had occurred in the then occupied NORP territories or in territories outside ORG , only NORP nationals or persons of NORP origin ( deutscher PERSON ) who were , at the time of the occurrence of the loss , stateless or had only the nationality of a ORG where they had been subjected to expropriation or expulsion measures on account of their NORP origin could claim compensation ( section CARDINAL ) ) . LAW listed works of art and collections among the losses excluded from compensation . The time - limit for filing compensation claims under LAW expired on DATE ( section DATE ) .
CARDINAL . During DATE , in parallel with internal NORP developments , ORG ( GPE , GPE , GPE and GPE ) negotiated to end the reserved rights of the Four Powers for GPE and GPE as a whole .

The LAW on LOC with respect to GPE ( the so - called LAW ) was eventually signed in GPE on DATE , and published in ORG on DATE ( pp . CARDINAL et seq . ) . The LAW confirms in particular the definite nature of the borders of the united GPE ( LAW . According to its LAW , the rights and responsibilities of the CARDINAL Powers relating to GPE and GPE as a whole terminated with the result that the corresponding , related quadripartite agreements , decisions and practices were terminated ; and the united GPE was given full sovereignty over its internal and external affairs . The LAW entered into force on DATE .

CARDINAL . As regards the above - mentioned ORG , as amended , an agreement was reached between the governments of GPE , GPE , GPE and GPE and GPE , following an exchange of notes on CARDINAL and DATE , which entered into force on the last - mentioned date ( ORG , DATE , pp . CARDINAL et seq . ) .
This agreement provides , inter alia :

“ CARDINAL . The Convention on Relations between the CARDINAL Powers and GPE of CARDINAL DATE ... ( “ the Relations Convention ” ) shall be suspended upon the suspension of the operation of quadripartite rights and responsibilities with respect to GPE and to GPE as a whole , and shall terminate upon the entry into force of LAW on the Final Settlement with respect to GPE , signed at GPE on DATE .

CARDINAL . Subject to paragraph CARDINAL below , ORG out of the War and the Occupation of CARDINAL DATE ... ( “ the Settlement Convention ” ) shall be suspended and shall terminate at the same time as LAW ; ...
CARDINAL . The following provisions of the Settlement Convention shall , however , remain in force :
LAW :
Article CARDINAL , paragraphs CARDINAL and CARDINAL
CARDINAL . The political union of GPE and GPE occurred on DATE , with the accession ( in accordance with LAW CARDINAL ORG which had been re - established in GPE .

CARDINAL . The second chapter of LAW to LAW ( Einführungsgesetz zum PERSON ) , as in force at the relevant time ( as amended by LAW zur Neuregelung des Internationalen GPE , ORG I , DATE , p. CARDINAL ) , contained statutory rules of NORP private international law relating to the rights of natural persons and the rules on legal transactions , family law and succession law . This legislation did not comprise statutory provisions on property matters and , before the entry into force of LAW Gesetz zum internationalen LOC ausservertragliche GPE und für ORG , ORG I , DATE , p. CARDINAL , amending LAW of LAW to LAW ) , the NORP courts applied customary law , that is , as a rule the lex rei sitae . According to section CARDINAL of LAW to LAW , the legal provisions of a foreign State shall not be applied if their application would lead to a result incompatible with essential principles of NORP law ( ordre public ) .
